intro: Stephanophorum purpuraceum, commonly known as the purple stephanophorum, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking purple flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. It plays an important role in the local ecosystem and is often found in coastal scrub habitats.
